result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Q. Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.
